comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Coinramp on September 06, 2023, 08:51:40 PMCheck it out today on: ]http://coinramp.net[/b][/center]You need to edit this link.I tried to understand the nature of the service you provide, I went to F.A.Q and found that to activate cards you need to verify your ID, however, you did not mention restrictions on countries, here you mentioned that your service is available in 100+ countries and on the site you mentioned +150, however I did not find a mention of prohibited countries from using this service.QuoteHow long does it take to set up an account?It takes about 5 minutes to create a new Coinramp account and verify your ID. Once you’re verified, you can now order a Coinramp Virtual Card in USD and EURO. Without verification, you can only deposit crypto and send funds to other Coinramp users.You have two types of cards: Card limits and Card+ limits. Although the limits are different, there are no additional conditions for obtaining Card+. They are the same requirements, which are verified your ID. However, the limits are about $25,000, which is rarely achieved once the identity is verified.QuoteDo I need to provide additional information in order to order a Coinramp Card+?No, once you verified your ID, you can order any card you need.You have different restrictions for USA which may include social security numberI see that the company's registration refers to -----> https://mercuryo.io/, but I did not find information about you on their site. Are you a third party relying on mercuryo?

Once you’re verified, you can now order a Coinramp Virtual Card in USD and EURO. Quote from: hugeblack on September 07, 2023, 10:18:33 AMYou have different restrictions for USA which may include social security numberI see that the company's registration refers to -----> https://mercuryo.io/, but I did not find information about you on their site. We use (regulated) services like mercuryo.io to handle crypto deposits and exchange, as we are not a crypto exchange. I hope I answer your questions, let me know if there is more I can help with!

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Nice to see another virtual card service that supports crypto deposits, but the fee seems to be too much for my liking, especially those monthly charges and Card loading fee. Maybe because I currently use some virtual Mastercard service that also supports crypto doesn't have such fees. Otherwise, different businesses have different ways of operating. That is just my feedback/observation.

That is just my feedback/observation.Hi logfiles,Thanks for your honest feedback, we are probably going to lower the monthly card fee when our user base will continue to grow. comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Coinramp on September 08, 2023, 02:01:20 PMThanks for your honest feedback, we are probably going to lower the monthly card fee when our user base will continue to grow. We are currently looking to find the right fit for us. Thing is, with the current fees it will be very hard for you to get any traction in EU because we are satured with bunch of cards with very low fees, high limits and even cashback. At the same time, you ask $15 per month to just use the card, then $2.9% card loading fee etc and on top of that we still have to do KYC like for any other card with much better terms.Don't get me wrong, it is good thing for us users to get more crypto cards and I wish you a good luck (assuming that you are legit company).
